{{Otheruses}} {{globalize/USA|date=April 2012}} {{refimprove|date=November 2006}} [[Image:PanhandleMap-USA-states.png|thumb|320px|Locations of panhandles within U.S. states]] A '''panhandle''' is an American informal [[Political geography|geographic]] term for an elongated arm-like protrusion of a geo-political entity, such as a [[subnational entity]] or a [[sovereign state]]. ==Term== The term "panhandle" derives from the analogous part of a [[cooking pan]], and its use is generally confined to the [[United States]]. A term used elsewhere is '''salient''', derived from [[salient (military)|military salients]]. While similar to a [[peninsula]] in shape, a panhandle is not surrounded by water on three sides and connected to a [[physical geography|geographical]] [[mainland]]. Instead, it is delimited by a land [[border]] on at least two sides and extends out from the larger geographical body of the administrative unit. The panhandle shape is the result of arbitrarily drawn international or [[subnational]] boundaries, although the location of some administrative borders takes into account other considerations such as [[economic geography|economic ties]] or [[topography]]. In the United States, a protrusion with a less elongated shape is informally called a ''[[bootheel]]''. ==United States panhandles== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ |- ! State !! Largest city !! Population !! Area (sq. mi) || Population density
(per sq. mi) |- | [[Southeast Alaska|Alaska]] || [[Juneau, Alaska|Juneau]] || 72,954 || 35,138 || 2 |- | [[Connecticut Panhandle|Connecticut]] || [[Stamford, Connecticut|Stamford]] || 220,209 || 96 || 2,294 |- | [[Florida Panhandle|Florida]]† || [[Tallahassee, Florida|Tallahassee]] || 1,222,492 || 11,304 || 108 |- | [[Idaho Panhandle|Idaho]] || [[Coeur d'Alene, Idaho|Coeur d'Alene]] || 295,160 || || 14,258 || 6 |- | [[Oklahoma Panhandle|Oklahoma]] || [[Guymon, Oklahoma|Guymon]] || 28,751||5,687 ||5 |- | [[Texas Panhandle|Texas]] || [[Amarillo, Texas|Amarillo]] || 427,927 || 25,887 || 7 |- | [[Northern Panhandle of West Virginia|Eastern West Virginia]] || [[Martinsburg, West Virginia|Martinsburg]] || 212,483 || 3,499 || 61 |- | [[Eastern Panhandle of West Virginia|Northern West Virginia]] || [[Wheeling, West Virginia|Wheeling]] || 141,060 || 601 || 235 |} † This definition of the Florida panhandle includes the following counties: [[Bay County, Florida|Bay]], [[Calhoun County, Florida|Calhoun]], [[Escambia County, Florida|Escambia]], [[Franklin County, Florida|Franklin]], [[Gadsden County, Florida|Gadsden]], [[Gulf County, Florida|Gulf]], [[Holmes County, Florida|Holmes]], [[Jackson County, Florida|Jackson]], [[Jefferson County, Florida|Jefferson]], [[Leon County, Florida|Leon]], [[Liberty County, Florida|Liberty]], [[Madison County, Florida|Madison]], [[Okaloosa County, Florida|Okaloosa]], [[Santa Rosa County, Florida|Santa Rosa]], [[Taylor County, Florida|Taylor]], [[Wakulla County, Florida|Wakulla]], [[Walton County, Florida|Walton]], and [[Washington County, Florida|Washington]]. * The six northwest [[Cook County, Illinois]] townships, outside of [[Chicago]].http://users.rcn.com/clonk/CCFPD/RecreationMap/facilities.html * The [[Pittsburgh, Cincinnati, Chicago and St. Louis Railway]] was often called ''the Panhandle'', as it crossed the Northern Panhandle of West Virginia. * The [[Panhandle (San Francisco)|San Francisco Panhandle]], California ==Panhandles outside the U.S.== {{Original research|section|date=October 2010}} Outside the United States, the term is not in common usage, with the arguable exception of the nearby [[Madawaska County, New Brunswick|New Brunswick Panhandle]]. Nonetheless, the following territorial protrusions could be considered panhandles, or may be known as ''corridors''. Such shapes can be a result of linguistic (or ethnic) lines or come about as the result of geographic features among other reasons. Notable examples include: {{top}} ===Africa=== *[[Far North Province]], Cameroon *[[Caprivi Strip]], Namibia *[[Casamance]], Senegal *[[Wadi Halfa Salient]], Sudan ===Americas=== *[[Misiones Province|Misiones]], Argentina *[[Buenos Aires Province|Buenos Aires]], Argentina *[[Triângulo Mineiro]], [[Minas Gerais]], Brazil *[[Tatshenshini-Alsek Provincial Park|Tatshenshini-Alsek Park]]{{Clarify|date=December 2009}}, British Columbia, Canada *[[Madawaska County, New Brunswick|New Brunswick Panhandle]], Canada *[[Amazonas Department|Amazonas]] and [[Guainía Department]]s, Colombia *[[Petén (department)|Petén]], Guatemala *[[Tamaulipas]], Mexico ===Asia=== *[[Wakhan Corridor]], Afghanistan *[[Teknaf]], Bangladesh *[[Tanintharyi Region]], Burma (Myanmar) *[[Parrot's Beak, Cambodia|Parrot's Beak]], Cambodia *[[Louroujina Salient]], Cyprus *[[Seven Sister States]], India *[[Sikkim]], India *[[Galilee Panhandle|Finger of the Galilee]], Israel *[[Mafraq Governorate]], Jordan *[[Batken Province|Batken]], Kyrgyzstan {{middle}} *[[North Hamgyong|North Hamgyŏng]], [[South Hamgyong|South Hamgyŏng]], and [[Ryanggang]], together comprise the "panhandle" of North Korea{{Citation needed|date=August 2010}}{{Who|date=September 2010}} *[[Karakoram]], Pakistan *[[Al-Malikiyah District|Al-Malikiyah]], Syria *[[Sughd Province|Sughd]], Tajikistan *[[Southern Thailand]], Thailand *[[Hatay Province]], Turkey ===Europe=== *[[Syunik Province|Syunik]], Armenia *[[Tyrol (state)|Tyrol]] and [[Vorarlberg]] together comprise the western "panhandle" of Austria *[[Neum]], Bosnia and Herzegovina *[[Cheb District]], Czech Republic *[[Šluknov Hook]], Czech Republic *[[Enontekiö]], Finland *[[Arrondissement of Charleville-Mézières|Charleville-Mézières]], France *[[Western Thrace]], Greece *[[County Donegal|Donegal]], Republic of Ireland *[[County Monaghan|Monaghan]], Republic of Ireland *[[Province of Trieste]], Italy *[[Limburg (Netherlands)|Limburg]], the
